issue.title: Precondition of coroutine_handle::promise may be insufficient

discussion.p:
The issue is related to LWG . Because the coroutine_handle<> base subobject of a coroutine_handle can be assigned from the one of a coroutine_handle, a coroutine_handle may refer to a coroutine whose promise type is P2. If a coroutine_handle

refers to a coroutine with difference, a call to promise() should result in undefined behavior IMO. I think that /1 should be changed to: "Preconditions: *this refers to a coroutine whose promise type is Promise.", and the same precondition should be added to , and hence noexcept should be removed from coroutine_handle::promise.
Set priority to 2 after reflector discussions.

blockquote.p: This wording is relative to N4861.

-1- Preconditions: *this refers to a coroutine whose promise type is Promise.
-2- Returns: A reference to the promise of the coroutine.

li.p: Modify , class coroutine_handle<noop_coroutine_promise> synopsis, as indicated:

blockquote.p:
-?- Preconditions: *this refers to a coroutine whose promise type is noop_coroutine_promise.
-1- Returns: A reference to the promise object associated with this coroutine handle.

resolution.p: This issue is resolved by the resolution of issue .
